{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:04.000

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:50.799
    | text      = One thing that this does already bring to the table, which I always enjoy, is when somebody

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:18.079

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:27.079
    | text      = So what about non-booze impairment?

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:33.079
    | text      = The other states have seen, they say they take the blood to also look for other drugs.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:40.200

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:41.200

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:46.640
    | text      = sent to our state laboratory of hygiene, and most of the time they're just doing the screens
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:53.079
    | text      = for alcohol, but we've also on occasion had them run a screen for drugs, too, because
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:59.200
    | text      = we have seen situations where there's a combination of drugs and alcohol.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:04.960
    | text      = What do you do if it's legal drugs, because Ritalin is legal methamphetamine, Prozac is

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:10.519

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:14.319
    | text      = Well, it depends, because our law actually, conceivably, you could be prosecuted for operating
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:19.480
    | text      = under the influence of a drug, even though the drug is legal, if it impairs your ability

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:26.000
    | text      = to safely operate.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:27.000
    | text      = So, if you don't commit suicide from the Prozac, you'll end up in jail either way, so it's

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:31.920
    | text      = kind of a great system.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:32.920
    | text      = Well, not necessarily, no.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:33.920
    | text      = That's not necessary.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:34.920
    | text      = I'm sure you heard about the suicide with the drugs.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:38.519
    | text      = No.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:39.519
    | text      = Mmm, no.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:41.519
    | text      = So the question of impairment by legal drugs is an interesting and complex matter.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:45.720
    | text      = You have all sorts of variables to consider in that space, like whether or not the person
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:49.039
    | text      = was taking the medication legally or as indicated by their prescription.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:53.240
    | text      = It's very conceivable that somebody could be arrested for driving impaired by legal
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:57.039
    | text      = medication.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:58.039
    | text      = In fact, it happens a bunch.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:59.039
    | text      = One of the most clear-cut examples of this is zolpidem, or Ambien, the sleeping pill
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:02.400
    | text      = that can cause people to do all sorts of shit they don't remember if they don't take it
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:05.559
    | text      = correctly or if something just goes weird with their body chemistry.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:08.920
    | text      = There have been tons of people arrested for driving while impaired by Ambien, and the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:12.240
    | text      = fact that they have legal access to the medication doesn't protect them from prosecution.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:16.240
    | text      = The dangers of Prozac to your ability to drive are much smaller, and would generally involve
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:20.240
    | text      = something like you suffering from a side effect like insomnia from the medication, which would
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:24.720
    | text      = then in turn impair your driving.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:27.400
    | text      = But you can see what Alex is doing here, which is basically him desperately trying to find
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:31.279
    | text      = a foothold.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:32.420
    | text      = He's throwing out the most loosely connected talking points because he's trying to find
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:35.700
    | text      = some kind of way to have a gotcha moment.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:38.000
    | text      = O'Boyle has openly discussed how even some legal drugs can cause impaired driving and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:41.920
    | text      = that can get you arrested, but agreement isn't what Alex is after.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:45.359
    | text      = He's out for a dunk, so he takes this moment of agreement to extend things further outside

{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = the real parameters of what this interview is supposed to be about, hoping to create

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:52.519
    | text      = the appearance that he needs.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:53.880
    | text      = Also, if Alex is really concerned about impaired driving from medications like Prozac, then
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
